solution.text:
Here, the class size varies. Let us apply the assumed mean method.
Then,
we obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Concentration & \text{no.of localities(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{di=xi-.75} & \text{fidi} \\\hline0-.3 & 14 & 0.15 & -.6 & (-8.4) \\.3-.6 & 20 & 0.45 & -.3 & (-6) \\.6-.9 & 20 & 0.75 & 0 & 0 \\.9-1.2 & 16 & 1.05 & .3 & 4.8 \\1.2-1.5 & 10 & 1.35 & .6 & 6 \\\hline Total & 80 & & & (-3.6) \\ \hline \end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sum fidi
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = .75 + \(\Sigma fidi\over \Sigma fi\) = .75 +\((-3.6)\over 80\) = 0.705

content.text:
A survey was conducted to find out the concentration of CO2 in the air.Following data was collected at different localities in Pune through the survey.Find the mean concentration of CO2 in the air in Pune.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Concentration & \text{0-.3} & \text{.3-.6} & \text{.6-.9} & \text{.9-1.2} & \text{1.2-1.5} \\ \hline \ Localities & 14 & 20 & 20 & 16 & 10 \\ \hline\end{array}

solution.text:
Here, the class size varies, and the xi's are large. Let us apply the direct method.
Then,
we obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Expenditure & \text{no.of students(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{fixi} \\\hline100-200 & 15 & 150 & 2250 \\200-300 & 17 & 250 & 4250 \\300-400 & 16 & 350 & 5600 \\400-500 & 14 & 450 & 6300 \\500-600 & 15 & 550 & 8250 \\\hline \ Total & 77 & & 26650 \\\hline\end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sum fixi
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = \(\Sigma fixi\over \Sigma fi\) = \(26650\over 77\) = 346.1039

content.text:
The following distribution shows the daily expenditure of students of a school. Find the mean daily expenditure of students of the school using the direct method
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Daily Expenditure & \text{100-200} & \text{200-300} & \text{300-400} & \text{400-500} & \text{500-600} \\No. of students & 15 & 17 & 16 & 14 & 15\end{array}

solution.text:
Here, the class size varies. Let us apply the assumed mean method.
Then,
we obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Study hours & \text{no.of students(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{di=xi-3.5} & \text{fidi} \\\hline1-2 & 9 & 1.5 & -2 & (-18) \\2-3 & 5 & 2.5 & -1 & (-5) \\3-4 & 18 & 3.5 & 0 & 0 \\4-5 & 10 & 4.5 & 1 & 10 \\5-6 & 9 & 5.5 & 2 & 18 \\\hline \ Total & 51 & & & 5 \\\hline \end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sumfidi
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = 3.5 + \(\Sigma fidi\over \Sigma fi\) = 3.5 +\(5\over 51\) = 3.59804

content.text:
A survey was conducted to know how much hours students study at home.Following data was collected in the survey.Find the mean hours students study at home using Assumed mean methode.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Study hours & \text{1-2} & \text{2-3} & \text{3-4} & \text{4-5} & \text{5-6} \\\hline \ No. of students & 9 & 5 & 18 & 10 & 9 \\ \hline\end{array}

solution.text:
Here, the class size varies. Let us apply the step-deviation method.
Then,
We obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Marks & \text{no.of students(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{ui=\(xi-50\over 20\)} & \text{fiui} \\\hline0-20 & 6 & 10 & -2 & (-12) \\20-40 & 5 & 30 & -1 & (-5) \\40-60 & 16 & 50 & 0 & 0 \\60-80 & 5 & 70 & 1 & 5 \\80-100 & 11 & 90 & 2 & 22 \\\hline \ Total & 43 & & & 10 \\ \hline\end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sum fiui
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = 50 + 20*\(\Sigma fiui\over \Sigma fi\) = 50 + 20*\(10\over 43\) = 54.65116

content.text:
Following data of the marks scored by the students in an examination was collected.Find the mean marks scored using step-deviation methode.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Marks & \text{0-20} & \text{20-40} & \text{40-60} & \text{60-80} & \text{80-100} \\\hline \ No. of students & 6 & 5 & 16 & 5 & 11 \\ \hline\end{array}

solution.text:
Here, the class size varies, and the xi's are large. Let us apply the direct method.
Then,
we obtain the data as in Table:
\begin{array}{c|lcr}Salary & \text{no.of employees(fi)} & \text{xi} & \text{fixi} \\\hline1000-3000 & 12 & 2000 & 24000 \\3000-5000 & 13 & 4000 & 52000 \\5000-7000 & f & 6000 & f*6000 \\7000-9000 & 7 & 8000 & 56000 \\ \hline Total & 32+f & & 132000+6000f \\\hline\end{array}
The sum of the values in the last column gives us \sum fixi
So,
the mean x of the given data is given by;
\(\bar x\) = \(\Sigma fixi\over \Sigma fi\) = \(132000+6000f\over 32+f\) = 5294
132000+6000f = 5294*(32+f)
132000+6000f = 169408+5294f
6000f-5294f = 169408-132000
706f = 37408
f = 52.99
it can not be fractional so, rounding off
f = 53

content.text:
Following table gives the information about the monthly salary of employees of a company.The mean salary is Rs. 5294.Find the missing frequency f.
\begin{array}{c|lcr} Salary & \text{1000-3000} & \text{3000-5000} & \text{5000-7000} & \text{7000-9000} \\ \hline \ No. of employees & 12 & 13 & f & 7 \\ \hline\end{array}
Round off the obtained answer
